DataElement.preferredName: Specimen Histology Sarcomatoid Features Present Percentage Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent the percentage of the sarcomatoid features present in the patient's cancer.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains._A microscopic finding indicating the presence of cells with sarcomatoid, usually spindle cell differentiation in a tumor sample._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.

Property.preferredDefinition: A microscopic finding indicating the presence of cells with sarcomatoid, usually spindle cell differentiation in a tumor sample.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: A microscopic finding indicating the presence of cells with sarcomatoid, usually spindle cell differentiation in a tumor sample.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed that is a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form
